core to to our mission and we Define our problem as information overload in
science and the the characteristics of that problem are that as the number of
of scientists around the world have grown and the number of research institutions and Publications have grown
the number of potentially relevant scientific papers for each individual
scholar to read has grown at an exponential Pace since World War II so
we're now at 3.5 million new Publications each year it grows about five or six percent yeah it grows at 5
or 6% a year and the number of new journals also grows so prolifer ation of
new Publications and if you're a scholar in a particular domain your ability to
read papers is is somewhat static at least in the short term so our our
Research indicates that the average scholar reads approximately 250 papers a
year the time they spend per paper is about 30 to 45 minutes and that comes
out to you know up to 15 hours a week just trying to understand what's new or relevant in their domain and so they
don't don't really have a good way to read more papers without the help of tools like semantic scholar so the way
that we think of our solution to information overload is if the Scholar's attention is fixed and we want to at
least the amount of time they have is is fixed we want to make it possible for them to overcome information overload by
